intro: Pedicularis flexosoides, commonly known as the bent-stem lousewort, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which is part of the family Orobanchaceae, known for its hemiparasitic relationships with host plants. The plant features reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer, often in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are typically alternate and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. Pedicularis flexosoides thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
